snippet: The program aims to keep defendants who are considered to be low risk out of the Rikers Island jail complex, placing them under court supervision as they await trial.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces plan to reform city's bail system, allowing many low-risk, nonviolent offenders to be released under court supervision while awaiting trial; measure is aimed at reducing population at Rikers Island jail complex while helping defendants who are unable to pay bail.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz and Michael Winerip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The program aims to keep defendants who are considered to be low risk out of the Rikers Island jail complex, placing them under court supervision as they await trial.

headline.main: New York City to Relax Bail Requirements for Low-Level Offenders
headline.print_headline: City to Relax Bail Requirements for Low-Level Offenders
